dt: {bc}of, relating to, or utilizing devices constructed or working by the methods or principles of {d_link|electronics|electronics} {bc}{sx|electronic||}

dt.t: {wi}digital{/wi} devices/technology

dt: {bc}characterized by electronic and especially computerized technology

dt.t: the {wi}digital{/wi} age
In an electronically driven work-place, managers pinpoint information overload as the inescapable downside to … life in the {wi}digital{/wi} world.

dt: {bc}composed of data in the form of especially binary digits {dx_def}see {dxt|digit||1b}{/dx_def}

dt.t: {wi}digital{/wi} images/photos
a {wi}digital{/wi} readout
a {wi}digital{/wi} broadcast {gloss}=a broadcast employing digital communications signals{/gloss}
a {wi}digital{/wi} voltmeter
a {wi}digital{/wi} watch/clock

dt: {bc}relating to an audio recording method in which sound waves are represented digitally (as on magnetic tape) so that in the recording {d_link|wow|wow:4} and {d_link|flutter|flutter:2} are eliminated and background noise is reduced
{bc}of, relating to, or using calculation by numerical methods or by discrete units
{bc}of or relating to the fingers or toes

dt.t: {wi}digital{/wi} dexterity
a {wi}digital{/wi} rectal examination

et: Middle English {it}digitalle{/it} "(of a whole number) less than ten," borrowed from Latin {it}digitālis{/it} "measuring a finger's breadth," from {it}digitus{/it} "finger, toe, finger's breadth as a measure" + {it}-ālis{/it} {et_link|-al:1|-al:1} {ma}{mat|digit|}{/ma}
shortdef: of, relating to, or utilizing devices constructed or working by the methods or principles of electronics : electronic; also : characterized by electronic and especially computerized technology
composed of data in the form of especially binary digits
providing a readout in numerical digits

dt: {bc}media (such as a photograph) in a {d_link|digital|digital:1} format

dt.t: This writer spent a frightfully snowy day stumbling around a snow-covered lawn among the downpour of snowflake clusters. Something black and cold became an impromptu netting device to capture {wi}digitals{/wi} of individual snowflakes.

dt: {bc}digital media as an industry or sector of an industry

dt.t: … radio advertising was up 6.8%, TV advertising was up 9.4%, and {wi}digital{/wi} was up 16.8%.

dt: {bc}something (such as a device) characterized or operated by digital technology

dt.t: Unlike {d_link|analog|analog:1} quartz watches, which had a conventional dial and hands, {wi}digitals{/wi} were totally electronic, with no moving parts at all.
The analog thermometers usually register from 0ºF to 220ºF and cost about $12; the {wi}digitals{/wi} register from -58ºF to 302ºF and go for around $15.
… critical ischemia of the {wi}digitals{/wi} of upper and lower limbs …

dt: {bc}an artery or nerve that supplies the fingers or toes

dt.t: … the doctor reported that ulnar palmar and radial palmar {wi}digitals{/wi}' decreased sensation had a maximum upper extremity impairment of 9 percent …

shortdef: media (such as a photograph) in a digital format
digital media as an industry or sector of an industry
something (such as a device) characterized or operated by digital technology

dt: {bc}the use by white people of digital {d_link|depictions|depiction} of Black or brown people or skin tones especially for the purpose of self-representation or self-expression

dt.t: In 2016, the company released a Bob Marley selfie filter as part of {ldquo}4/20 day{rdquo} celebrations that darkened users' skin in a caricature of the reggae icon, prompting backlash from users who pointed out the lens was {wi}digital blackface{/wi}.
While reaction GIFs can be hilarious, when white people use GIFs of black people, it can be a form of {wi}digital blackface{/wi}.

shortdef: the use by white people of digital depictions of Black or brown people or skin tones especially for the purpose of self-representation or self-expression

dt: {bc}a camera that records images as digital data instead of on film

shortdef: a camera that records images as digital data instead of on film

dt: {bc}a computer that operates with numbers expressed directly as digits {dx}compare {dxt|analog computer||}, {dxt|hybrid computer||}{/dx}

shortdef: a computer that operates with numbers expressed directly as digits

dt: {bc}the economic, educational, and social inequalities between those who have computers and online access and those who do not

shortdef: the economic, educational, and social inequalities between those who have computers and online access and those who do not

dt: {bc}someone who performs their occupation entirely over the Internet while traveling

dt.t: Let's say you're thinking about becoming a {wi}digital nomad{/wi} this summer, making the most of your company's work-from-home policy as borders reopen before the bosses require you back in the office.

dt: {bc}such a person who has no permanent fixed home address

dt.t: Most people have to pay to commute to and from work every day, which also leads to wear and tear on vehicles and the potential for costly repairs. As a {wi}digital nomad{/wi}, Vonwiegen doesn't have to worry about these expenses. That means more money in his pocket—or retirement account.

Another trend is to eschew both the office and the home and to work more or less permanently on the road. The result is the phenomenon of the {wi}digital nomad{/wi}, a person who uses technology, particularly wireless networking, to work without requiring a fixed address.

shortdef: someone who performs their occupation entirely over the Internet while traveling; especially : such a person who has no permanent fixed home address

dt: {bc}a high-speed communications connection used for accessing the Internet and carrying short-range transmissions over ordinary telephone lines

shortdef: a high-speed communications connection used for accessing the Internet and carrying short-range transmissions over ordinary telephone lines —abbreviation DSL
